content:
There may be a simpler way, but this is my way:

- exit thunderbird - locate the archive in your profile and COPY (not move) to your other drive. Ignore the msf - restart thunderbird and click account settings and copies&folders and change to location for archive to the new location - at that point, thunderbird may close and restart - if satisfied with results, you can then delete the original archive location - to backup:

  1. ensure thunderbird is not running
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. copy the external archive from its location
creator: davidsk

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Purtroppo non lo so. Non dovrebbe esserci differenza nel metodo di autenticazione sia usando la password dell'account sia la password per applicazione. Cosa usare però te lo dovrebbe dire Aruba. Se i parametri sono quelli di questa pagina -> https://guide.pec.it/posta-pec/configurare-casella-pec/configurare-casella-pec-programma-posta.aspx allora devi usare SSL/TLS per Sicurezza della connessione Password normale per Metodo di autenticazione

content:
Probeer eens de map(pen) te repareren door:

  • Klik met uw rechtermuisknop op de map
  • Selecteer Eigenschappen… in het contextmenu van de map
  • Gebruik de knop Map repareren
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: In mijn versie komt er geen optie Map Repareren als ik op de rechtermuisknop klik. Ik heb op basis van jullie suggestie Thunderbird opnieuw gedownload en geinstalleerd. Nu is het probleem opgelost.
creator: theo.helsloot

content: With an IMAP account, if you see folders in profile view in Windows but not in Thunderbird, then you can delete them. If, on restarting thunderbird, the folders reappear, that would indicate they are real and part of the account.
creator: davidsk

content: It will help to know how you imported the addresses from Outlook.
creator: davidsk

content:
The change is that you now have a choice of continuing with the ExtendedSupportRelease (ESR) version or switching to the new Monthly version that will have the latest releases and updated monthly. These two URLs provide more info: - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/choosing-thunderbird-release-channel - https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-release

You now have a choice, but switching is an option, as the ESR will continue to be supported. If you wish to remain with ESR, no action is needed. Thanks for asking.
creator: davidsk
